country.decode: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

organizationLegalAddress.text: Somewhere, In a City, In a District, In a big state, 12345, France

studyDesigns.name: Study Design 1
studyDesigns.description: The main design for the study

studyObjectives.name: OBJ1
studyObjectives.description: The primary efficacy objective for this study is to evaluate the efficacy of TCZ compared with placebo in combination with SOC for the treatment of severe COVID-19 pneumonia

objectiveEndpoints.name: END1
objectiveEndpoints.text: Clinical status assessed using a 7-category ordinal scale at Day 28

studyObjectives.name: OBJ2
studyObjectives.description: The secondary efficacy objective for this study is to evaluate the efficacy of TCZ compared with placebo in combination with SOC for the treatment of severe COVID-19 pneumonia

objectiveEndpoints.name: END2
objectiveEndpoints.text: Time to clinical improvement (TTCI) defined as a National Early Warning Score 2 (NEWS2) of <=2 maintained for 24 hours

objectiveEndpoints.name: END3
objectiveEndpoints.text: Time to improvement of at least 2 categories relative to baseline on a 7-category ordinal scale of clinical status

objectiveEndpoints.name: END6
objectiveEndpoints.text: Incidence of intensive care unit (ICU) stay

objectiveEndpoints.name: END8
objectiveEndpoints.text: Time to clinical failure, defined as the time to death, mechanical ventilation, ICU admission, or withdrawal (whichever occurs first). For patients entering the study already in ICU or on mechanical ventilation, clinical failure is defined as a one-category worsening on the ordinal scale, withdrawal or death.

objectiveEndpoints.name: END10
objectiveEndpoints.text: Time to hospital discharge or “ready for discharge” (as evidenced by normal body temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or <= 2L supplemental oxygen)

objectiveEndpoints.name: END11
objectiveEndpoints.text: Time to recovery, defined as discharged or “ready for discharge” (as evidenced by normal body temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or <= 2L supplemental oxygen); OR, in a non-ICU hospital ward (or “ready for hospital ward”) not requiring supplemental oxygen

studyScheduleTimelines.name: Main Timeline
studyScheduleTimelines.label: Main Timeline
studyScheduleTimelines.description: This is the main timeline for the study design.

intercurrentEvents.name: termination
intercurrentEvents.intercurrentEventStrategy: Patients with out of range lab values before dosing will be excluded

activities.name: Something Else
activities.activityIsConditionalReason: Only do this if they have two heads
